programme.title: Cap Sud-Ouest
programme.desc: Corrèze, the Dordogne Gorges Dramatic landscapes of high plateaux and steep-sided valleys carved by rivers, the most important being the Dordogne: discover the Haute-Corrèze, land of exceptional panoramas and a unique history. Presented by: Éric Perrin.

programme.title: Une brique dans le ventre
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Épicerie fine
programme.desc:
The Espinouse Massif
In the Espinouse Massif, we meet Lilian and his swarm of bees. At the Les Taillades Farm, Aline and Guillaume have plenty to keep them busy, between caring for the animals and maturing the cheeses. All you need to know about the Pardailhan turnip; exploring the Hérépian Bell Museum.
Presented by: Guy Martin Directed by: Émilie Darnaud (France, 2022)

programme.title: La tête à l'endroit
programme.desc: Who understands Burgundian? Sandwiched between Paris and Lyon and spanning Burgundy's four départements, the Morvan area has own unique characteristics and customs. Can someone from Belfort, Jura or even Dijon understand the Burgundian language? Presenter: Guillaume Pierre.

programme.title: Météo à la carte
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: L'épicerie
programme.sub-title: Séduire les employés... par le ventre
programme.desc:
The way to an employee's heart... through their stomach?
Does offering employees attractive meal options make good economic sense? Also on the programme: testing hand mixers; discovering ajvar, Balkan caviar; and a cake from Transylvania.
Presented by: Johane Despins.

programme.title: La peinture française autour du monde
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Cap Sud-Ouest
programme.desc: Entre-deux-Mers, on the trail of ecological resilience We head for the Entre-deux-Mers, one of the most beautiful areas of the Gironde. Vineyards, châteaux, and gently rolling countryside have won it the nickname of the Tuscany of the Bordelais. Here some of the inhabitants prefer a different relationship with nature, such as transforming stone quarries into mushroom farms... Presented by: Éric Perrin.

programme.title: Une brique dans le ventre
programme.desc: A contemporary Q-Zen house We head to Lasne to discover a house half-way between sculpture and architecture: the Q-Zen house and its particularly strict ecological and energy-saving requirements. Also on the programme: up-cycling with Namufacture; La Siroperie, a holiday home in Antheit, and how to make a log store. Presented by: Cédric Wautier, Virginie Jacobs.

programme.title: Épicerie fine
programme.desc:
The Maremne and the Marensin
We head for the regions of La Maremne and Le Marensin, where Thomas picks asparagus and strawberries growing in the sandy Landes soil. Between vines and cellar Alan's wines keep him fully occupied. All about the Landes pastis and local actions in favour of the climate.
Presented by: Guy Martin Directed by: Émilie Darnaud (France, 2022)

programme.title: La tête à l'endroit
programme.desc: Flavigny: its aniseed, history and regional identity Flavigny-sur-Ozerain is considered as one of France's finest villages. The municipality, whose narrow streets are brimming with architectural treasures dating from the Middle Ages and the Renaissance, delights passers-by and occasional visitors. Presenter: Guillaume Pierre.

programme.title: L'épicerie
programme.sub-title: Les profits grandissants des grandes chaînes d'alimentation
programme.desc:
Ever-higher profits for the major supermarket chains
Are supermarket chains using inflation as an excuse to increase their profits? We investigate... Also on the programme: how to reduce your bill at the supermarket check-out; all about tamarind, a strange fruit that bring a touch of acidity; and a delicatessen meat from eastern Europe, the kielbasa.
Presented by: Johane Despins, Myriam Fehmiu.

programme.title: La peinture française autour du monde
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: #VF
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Cap Sud-Ouest
programme.desc: Entre-deux-Mers, on the trail of ecological resilience We head for the Entre-deux-Mers, one of the most beautiful areas of the Gironde. Vineyards, châteaux, and gently rolling countryside have won it the nickname of the Tuscany of the Bordelais. Here some of the inhabitants prefer a different relationship with nature, such as transforming stone quarries into mushroom farms... Presented by: Éric Perrin.

programme.title: Tendance XXI
programme.desc:
Special feature on fashion design
Identity and change, haute couture's relationship to all aspects of fashion design with Stéphane Rolland. Gloves are more than a useful accessory: we meet the Swedish glove maker Thomasine Barnekow. Mugler, Dior, Chanel, Schiaparelli... Michel Carel goes behind-the-scenes to showcase the great designers' most extravagant ideas.
Commentary: Viviane Blassel.

programme.title: Papilles
programme.desc:
Patrick Jeffroy
In the Finistère, we meet the Breton chef Patrick Jeffroy and his disciples. This indomitable Gaul invites us to discover the unique people and ingredients that made him a Michelin-starred chef, all set against the spectacular background of the Brittany coast.
Presented by: Emmanuelle Delteil.

programme.title: La belle vie
programme.desc: Life in a geodesic dome Julien meets Mark and Chris on Gambier Island, where the two friends and professional skiers live in a geodesic dome. Julien gives them a hand with some of their on-going projects. Presented by: Julien Roussin-Côté.

programme.title: L'épicerie
programme.desc:
Natural wines
The market for natural wines is constantly growing... Farm-restaurants: a new trend? What's on the menu at a mi'kmaw wedding? Goji and açai berries, chia seeds, do all these so-called super foods really have miraculous properties?
Presented by: Johane Despins.

programme.title: La peinture française autour du monde
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Les 100 lieux qu'il faut voir
programme.desc: The Allier, from Vichy to the meanders of the River Allier The Allier, one of France's few remaining wild rivers, rushing impetuously across Auvergne, gave its name to a department that covers the former French province of Bourbonnais. We discover the Sioule Gorges; taking the waters and how it made Vichy famous; Moulins, once the capital of the Dukes of Bourbon... Directed by: Pierre Lalanne-Labeyrie (season 5, France, 2018)

programme.title: Cap Sud-Ouest

programme.title: Ricardo
programme.desc:
Shortbread, clafoutis and chocolate clusters
For a speedy solution when you need a sugar fix, Ricardo presents three recipes that only take a few minutes and a single bowl to prepare: chocolate shortbread biscuits, cherry clafoutis and chocolate-coated blueberry-hazelnut clusters
Presented by: Ricardo Larrivée.

programme.title: Maestro !
programme.desc: Don Pasquale "Don Pasquale", the comic opera by Gaetano Donizetti and Giovanni Ruffini was performed for the first time at the Comédie-Italienne in Paris, in 1843. Damiano Michieletto made the opera his own when he produced it at the Opéra de Paris in 2018. Presented by: Éric de Lochner. Directed by: Éric de Lochner (France, 2021)

programme.title: Les 100 lieux qu'il faut voir
programme.desc: The Allier, from Vichy to the meanders of the River Allier The Allier, one of France's few remaining wild rivers, rushing impetuously across Auvergne, gave its name to a department that covers the former French province of Bourbonnais. programme.title: 5 chefs dans ma cuisine
programme.sub-title: Poulet Jerk et frites de bananes plantains
programme.desc: Jerk chicken and fried plantain chips Paul Toussaint shares his recipe for jerk chicken and makes plantain chips to accompany. Presented by: Marina Orsini. Directed by: Nicole Dussault, David Gauthier, Stéphane Rocheleau, Léo Boulanger (Canada, 2020)

programme.title: Le grand move
programme.desc: Manon and Alain, Magdalen Islands After having taken the decision to sell their duplex right in the heart of Montreal, Manon and Alain set their heading for the Magdalen Islands. Directed by: Mariloup Wolfe (Canada, 2020)

programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Maestro !
programme.desc: Rigoletto Three acts and four scenes for "Rigoletto", by Giuseppe Verdi, based on a play by Victor Hugo "Le Roi S'Amuse", created at the Teatro La Fenice in 1851. With extracts from Claus Guth's 2016 production at the Opéra de Paris. Presented by: Éric de Lochner. Directed by: Éric de Lochner (France, 2021)

programme.title: Les 100 lieux qu'il faut voir
programme.desc: Anjou, from Saumur to the meanders of the Loire Between vineyards, châteaux and cave dwellings, Anjou never fails to delight thanks to its gentle lifestyle and its wide diversity of landscapes with their ever-changing light. The Anjou region links the sandy plateaux of the Saumurois to the rolling hillsides of the Loire Valley, and the green of the Baugeois. Directed by: Philippe Vergeot (season 5, France, 2018)

programme.title: Cap Sud-Ouest
programme.desc: Entre-deux-Mers, on the trail of ecological resilience We head for the Entre-deux-Mers, one of the most beautiful areas of the Gironde. Vineyards, châteaux, and gently rolling countryside have won it the nickname of the Tuscany of the Bordelais. Here some of the inhabitants prefer a different relationship with nature, such as transforming stone quarries into mushroom farms... Presented by: Éric Perrin.

programme.title: Curieux Bégin
programme.desc: A little trip to Charlevoix Christian heads off to meet friends on the other side of the river, in the delightful region of Charlevoix. Pioneer in making the most of its terroir in terms of food, it offers a unique culinary trail under the expert guidance of the top chef Jean Soulard. Presented by: Christian Bégin.

programme.title: #Versionfrançaise
programme.desc: Programme summary: - Behind the scenes at the Unesco building - Encounter with Pierre Bonnefille, designer and Maître d'Art - Paris, in the footsteps of Honoré de Balzac - Encounter with Delphine Lescuyer, mosaicist Presented by: Katherina Marx.
